page.title: 08BATTLE OF FLOWERS MUSEUM
page.content:
Miss Florence Bechelet has been entering in the annual Battle of Flowers for the past fifty years and for most of them has entered the wild flower class. She has won many awards and since 1971 has displayed all her floats at the museum which she opened in that year.
So famous is her work that stamps have been issued featuring one of her floats and in 1978 she made a special float consisting of forty flamingos to show the Queen on her official visit to the Island.
The Battle of Flowers is held every year in early August but visitors to the Island can see some of the skill and patience which goes into these floats when they visit this Museum at any time of the year.
